--- title: "" format: revealjs: chalkboard: true --- ## Wildlife Ecology Modeling (FW680A4) {.smaller .scrollable} ```{=html} NRS FW680A4 Course Page ``` ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Start

Schedule/Syllabus

#### To do Install the most versions of R and RStudio. Github
#### Notes - To download lectures. Go to lecture html. Click 'e'. This should connect all slides into one page. Right Click Mouse on page. Click 'Print". Choose printer "Adobe PDF"; might need Adobe Acrobat installed. ### Learning R Prelude In R Data Carpentry Intro to R Many Resources Our Coding Club SW Carpentry Jeff Doser Book ### Week 1 - Lecture: 1) Introduction, 2) Information - Lecture Code: Information.R - Markdown Example: 1) Markdown Example File, 2) Compiled HTML - Assignment: 1) Markdown File 2) Compiled HTML - Assigned Reading ### Week 2 We will be working in R and Markdown. For class, we will be going through (at least) modules 1 and 2. We will also do a bit on Markdown. - R Lecture Modules: R Class.zip - R project organization example: Project Structure.zip - Assigned Reading ### Week 3 - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("pwr","ggplot2", "spsurvey", "foreach", "sf", "doParallel", "grDevices","tictoc","plotly")) ``` ::: - Lecture: Study Design - Lecture Code: StudyDesign.R - Download: Zip - Assignment (option 1): 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Assignment (option 2): 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Assignment (option 3): 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Assigned Readings 1) Probability Distributions, 2) Probability First Principles - Suggested Readings ### Week 4 - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("visualize","plotly")) ``` ::: - Lecture: Probabilty - Lecture Code: Probabilty.R - Download: - Assignment: 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Assigned Reading Betts et al. 2021 and Linear Regression Book Chapter or Online Linear Regression ### Week 5 No Class / Holiday ### Week 6 - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("sjPlot","ggplot2", "ggResidpanel")) ``` ::: - Lecture: Regression - Lecture Code: regression.R - Download: csv - Assignment: 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Assigned Readings: Assigned Reading ### Week 7 - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("equatiomatic","faux")) ``` ::: - Lecture: GLM - Lecture Code: linear.model.R - Assignment: 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Assigned Readings: Assigned Reading ### Week 8 - Download/Install JAGS software [here](https://sourceforge.net/projects/mcmc-jags/). The version you pick will depend on your version of R. - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("rjags","bayesplot","rstanarm")) ``` ::: - Lecture: Bayesian - Lecture Code: Bayesian.R - Data Download: Data Set 1, and Data Set 2 - Jags Code Example: Script, and Model - Stan Code Example: Script - Extra Model Files: MCMC Algorithim Example: R Script, and MCMC Algorithim Function - Assignment: 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML - Re-read the previously assigned Reading: Assigned Reading - Find a scientific paper that uses Bayesian modeling/inference in your subject area of interest. Be prepared to talk about what the study was about, how the authors used priors, what they made inference on, and how clear were the elements of modeling inference/modeling/computation. ### Week 9 No Class or New Homework ### Week 10 - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("rjags","bayesplot","runjags","coda")) ``` ::: - Lecture: Random Effect - Lecture Code: random.effect.R ### Week 11 - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("rjags","bayesplot","runjags","coda")) ``` ::: - Data Simulation Code (developed previous class): Inclass.data.simulation.r - JAGS Models: model.JAGS.extra.noise.r and model.JAGS.random.slope.r - Model Scripts: Model.Script.Extra.Noise.r and Model.Script.Random.Slope.r - Assignment: 1) Markdown File 1) Compiled HTML ### Week 12 Lecture/Lab by **Laken, Maegan, Owen, and John** - Install R packages: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("unmarked","rgeos", "sf", "raster")) ``` ::: - Lecture: Occupancy - Assigned Readings: Assigned Reading and associated questions. - Code : NRS520-Occupancy-ClassCode.R - Assignment: NRS 520-Occupancy Assignment.docx ### Week 13 Lecture/Lab by **Caroline, Corey, and Rea** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages(c("Hmisc","foreign","reshape2")) ``` ::: - Assigned Reading: Assigned Reading and Discussion Questions. - Lecture: Ordinal Regression - Lecture Code: UCLA_Code.R - Data Download: Data Set - Assignment: OLR HW Questions.docx ### Week 14 Lecture/Lab by **Tori, Liam, and Rebeca** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("dplyr", "ggplot2", "lme4") ``` ::: - Assigned Reading: Assigned Reading and RSF Paper Discussion Questions.docx. - Lecture: Slides - Data Download: Data Download - Code Download: Code Download - Assignment: Markdown and HTML - Appendix A: AppendixA.html ### Project - Create a group of 3 - The group should discuss ideas in quantitative ecology that you would all like to develop a class dedicated to. If you need help, schedule a time to talk with me. - Outline a plan: - Identify a reading that will be assigned prior to class along with relevant topic questions - Identify the scope and depth of the lecture material (bullet points of what will be covered), - Identify what the goal is to be accomplished in terms of coding (bullet points) - Decide on a general idea for a homework assignment. - Once outlined, email me the plan with all group members names. I will look over the general plan and provide comments. - From here, I expect you to move forward with your plan and reach out when you have questions. Arrange at least one time to walk me through the lesson plan prior to the class, such that there is enough time to implement any feedback. :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
